summary: Incomplete bug report — images not appearing on screen, but no actual code, repro steps, or error details provided (template placeholders only)

reproEvidence.environmentDetails: IDE: Visual Studio (Windows), Platform: macOS, SkiaSharp 3.116.0, Last Known Good: 2.88.9

analysis.summary: This issue contains only the default bug template with placeholder text — no actual code, no expected or actual behavior, no screenshots, no logs. The title mentions images not appearing but provides zero actionable information. Cannot determine root cause or even confirm a real bug exists.
analysis.rationale: type: The reporter used the bug template and the title says '[BUG]'. While the content is empty, they claim something is not working ('images not appearing'). Keeping type/bug but with very low confidence since there is no actual evidence of broken behavior. area: No specific component mentioned. 'Images not appearing' is too vague to narrow down — could be core SkiaSharp, Views, or MAUI. Defaulting to the broadest area. platforms[0]: Reporter selected 'macOS' as platform. However, they also say IDE is 'Visual Studio (Windows)' which is contradictory — they may be developing on Windows targeting macOS, or this may be a template selection error. bugSignals.severity: Cannot assess severity without any actual details. No crash, no stack trace, no repro, no description of the problem beyond the title. Defaulting to low until more information is available. actionability.suggestedAction: The issue is entirely template placeholders. We need actual code, expected behavior, actual behavior, and ideally a sample project before any investigation can begin. platforms: Reporter selected macOS as the platform in the bug template. The IDE field says Visual Studio (Windows), which is contradictory — trusting the explicit platform selection over the IDE choice. regression.isRegression: Reporter selected 2.88.9 as last known good version, but the entire report is template placeholders with no actual details. This selection may not reflect real testing, so regression cannot be confirmed. versionAnalysis.currentRelevance: Reporter selected 3.116.0 and 2.88.9, but no details confirm whether a real issue exists. The version selections may be default template values rather than reflecting actual testing.
nextQuestions: Whether this is a real bug report or an accidental submission of the empty template
What kind of images — SKImage, SKBitmap, or UI framework image controls
Whether the issue is in core SkiaSharp drawing, views rendering, or a platform-specific display problem
Whether the v2.88.9 'last known good' reflects actual testing or default selection
Whether the macOS platform selection is accurate given the Windows IDE selection

resolution.hypothesis: The reporter has code that should display images using SkiaSharp but nothing appears on screen. Without any details, the most common causes are: incorrect drawing coordinates, missing invalidation/refresh of the canvas view, image loading failures returning null, or v2-to-v3 API migration issues.

proposals.description: Ask the reporter to fill in the template with actual code, expected behavior, actual behavior, and ideally a minimal repro project. This is a prerequisite for any investigation.
If the reporter confirms this worked in v2.88.9, investigate common v3 migration pitfalls like API changes, namespace changes, or rendering pipeline differences.
Share a checklist of common reasons images don't appear: null image from loading, drawing at wrong coordinates, canvas not invalidated, view not sized correctly.

actionability.reason: The issue body contains only template placeholders — no real code, no expected/actual behavior, no logs, no screenshots. Investigation is impossible without more details.

actions.description: Request the reporter to fill in the bug template with actual details
